snippet: After nearly 200 cases of human infection and 10 deaths in Dallas County, Dallas’s mayor authorized aerial pesticide spraying, spurring a backlash.
abstract: Outbreak of mosquito-borne disease West Nile virus engulfs Dallas County, Tex, with nearly 200 cases of human infection and 10 deaths; Mayor Michael S Rawlings authorizes aerial pesticide spraying, but an online petition draws 1,700 signatures asking that it be stopped.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Donald G. McNeil Jr. from New York.

lead_paragraph: After nearly 200 cases of human infection and 10 deaths in Dallas County, Dallas’s mayor authorized aerial pesticide spraying, spurring a backlash.

headline.main: West Nile Hits Hard Around Dallas, With Fear of Its Spread
headline.print_headline: West Nile Virus Hits Hard in Dallas Area, Amid Fears of Wider Outbreak

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
